00041 static double median(const vector<double> & u)
00042 {
00043         int len = (int) u.size();
00044         long half = len / 2;
00045         return (len % 2 == 1 ? u[half] : (u[half - 1] + u[half]) / 2.0);
00046 }
00047 
00048 static double PercentileCV(const vector<double> &data, int innerPercentile, double median)
00049 {
00050     int startIndex = (int)(data.size() * (100 - innerPercentile) / 200.0);
00051     int endIndex = data.size() - startIndex;
00052     double stdv = 0.0;
00053     double diff = 0.0;
00054     double sumOfSquares = 0.0;
00055     double avg = 0.0f;
00056     for (int valIndex = startIndex; valIndex < endIndex; valIndex++)
00057     {
00058         avg += data[valIndex];
00059     }
00060     avg /= (endIndex - startIndex);
00061     for (int valIndex = startIndex; valIndex < endIndex; valIndex++)
00062     {
00063         diff = (avg - data[valIndex]);
00064         sumOfSquares += diff * diff;
00065     }
00066     if (sumOfSquares != 0 && (endIndex - startIndex) != 0) {
00067         stdv = std::sqrt(sumOfSquares / (endIndex - startIndex - 1));
00068     }
00069     return stdv / avg;
00070 }
00071 
00072 static string GetFileTitle(const string &file)
00073 {
00074         string name;
00075         string::size_type start = file.rfind("\\");
00076         if (start == string::npos)
00077                 start = file.rfind("/");
00078         if (start == string::npos)
00079                 start = 0;
00080         else
00081                 ++start;
00082         string::size_type end = file.rfind(".");
00083         if (end == string::npos)
00084                 end = file.length();
00085         name = file.substr(start, end-start);
00086     return name;
00087 }
00088 
00089 static vector<string> replaceTag(string replacementString, string tag, vector<string> replacementValues)
00090 {
00091         vector<string> results;
00092 
00093         string::size_type start = replacementString.find(tag);
00094 
00095         // The tag must be in the replacementString if there is more than one replacementValue to ensure that the results are
00096         // unique.
00097         if (replacementValues.size() > 1 && start == string::npos)
00098         {
00099                 Err::errAbort("Input parameter is missing a required tag. '" + replacementString + "' is missing: '" + tag + "'");
00100         }
00101         
00102         if (start != string::npos)
00103         {
00104                 // Found a replacement tag.
00105                 for (vector<string>::iterator it = replacementValues.begin(); it != replacementValues.end(); ++it)
00106                 {
00107                         string result = replacementString;
00108                         result.replace(start, tag.length(), *it);
00109                         results.push_back(result);
00110                 }
00111         }
00112         else
00113         {
00114                 // Return the string unchanged.
00115                 results.push_back(replacementString);
00116         }
00117         return results;
00118 }
00119 
00120 static void trimSpaces(string& str)
00121 {
00122         // Trim Both leading and trailing spaces
00123         size_t startpos = str.find_first_not_of(" \t"); // Find the first character position after excluding leading blank spaces
00124         size_t endpos = str.find_last_not_of(" \t");            // Find the first character position from reverse af
00125 
00126         // if all spaces or empty return an empty string
00127         if(( string::npos == startpos ) || ( string::npos == endpos))
00128         {
00129                 str = "";
00130         }
00131         else
00132                 str = str.substr( startpos, endpos-startpos+1 );
00133 }
00134 
00135 static vector<string> split(const string& inputString, const string& delim)
00136 {
00137         vector<string> tokens;
00138         size_t substrBegin = 0;
00139         for (;;)
00140         {
00141                 size_t substrEnd = inputString.find (delim, substrBegin);
00142                 if (substrEnd == string::npos)
00143                 {
00144                         // No more delim - save what's left, quit.
00145                         string subString = inputString.substr (substrBegin);
00146                         trimSpaces(subString);
00147                         // Avoid returning a null string from a terminating '?' or an empty inputString.
00148                         if (! subString.empty())
00149                                 tokens.push_back (subString);
00150                         break;
00151                 }
00152                 // Avoid null strings from an initial 'delim' or 'delimdelim'.
00153                 if (substrEnd != substrBegin)
00154                 {
00155                         string token(inputString.substr(substrBegin, substrEnd - substrBegin));
00156                         trimSpaces(token);
00157                         tokens.push_back (token);
00158                 }
00159                 // Continue following the delim
00160                 substrBegin = substrEnd + delim.size();
00161         }
00162         return tokens;
00163 }
00164 
00165 static vector<string> split(const string &inputString)
00166 {
00167         return split(inputString, "?");
00168 }
00169 
00170 static string parseAlleleCode(string channel, string alleleCode)
00171 {
00172         string delim = "//";
00173 
00174         vector<string> channels = split(channel, delim);
00175         vector<string> alleleCodes = split(alleleCode, delim);
00176 
00177         if (channels.size() != alleleCodes.size())
00178         {
00179                 Err::errAbort("Channel-Allele Code mismatch - Order: " + channel + ", Allele Code:" + alleleCode);
00180         }
00181         
00182         string result;
00183         for (int i = 0; i < channels.size(); ++i)
00184 
00185         {
00186                 int pos = atoi(channels[i].c_str());
00187                 if (result.size() < pos)
00188                         result.resize(pos);
00189                 result[pos-1] = alleleCodes[i][0];
00190         }
00191 
00192         return result;
00193 }
00194 
00195 static int decodeChannel(const string& signalColumn)
00196 {
00197         string::size_type pos = signalColumn.find_first_of("0123456789");
00198         if (pos == string::npos)
00199         {
00200                 Err::errAbort("Unable to deduce channel number: " + signalColumn);
00201         }
00202 
00203         return atoi(signalColumn.substr(pos, 1).c_str());
00204 }

00209 {

00211                 return (ListSummaryEngine *)engine;
00212         return NULL;
00213 }

00222 void ListSummaryEngine::defineOptions() {
00223         defineOption("", "list-files", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00224                 "Text file specifying list files to process, one per line with the first line being 'list_files'.",
00225                 "");
00226         defineOption("p", "algo-params", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00227                 "A string specifying algo parameters. See --explain option for acceptable parameters.",
00228                 "");
00229         defineOption("", "summary-out-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00230                 "File to write result (summaries) files into.",
00231                 "");
00232         defineOption("", "cv-out-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00233                 "File to write result (cv) files into.",
00234                 "");
00235         defineOption("", "count-out-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00236                 "File to write result (counts) files into.",
00237                 "");
00238         defOptMult("l", "lists", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00239                 "List files to process.",
00240         "");

00242                 "The marker content file.",
00243         "");

00245                 "The annotation file.",
00246         "");

00248                 "The column name for the input files.",
00249         "list_files");

00251                 "The column name for the particle code.",
00252         "PartCode");

00254                 "The column name for the note.",
00255         "Note");
00256         defineOption("", "probe-id-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00257                 "The column name for the probe id.",
00258         "Probe Id");

00260                 "The column name for the type.",
00261         "Type");

00278                 "Include codes not found in the mix or annotation files.",
00279         "no");
00280 }

00284 /**
00285  * Make sure that our options are sane. Call Err::errAbort if not.
00286  */
00287 void ListSummaryEngine::checkOptionsImp()
00288 {
00289         defineStates();
00290         string file;
00291         file = getOpt("summary-out-file");
00292         if (file.empty() == true)
00293                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an output summary file.");
00294         file = getOpt("cv-out-file");
00295         if (file.empty() == true)
00296                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an output cv file.");
00297         file = getOpt("count-out-file");
00298         if (file.empty() == true)
00299                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an output count file.");
00300         file = getOpt("marker-content-file");
00301         if (file.empty() == true)
00302                 Err::errAbort("Must specify a marker content file.");
00303         file = getOpt("annotation-file");
00304         if (file.empty() == true)
00305                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an annotation file.");
00306 
00307         // Read in list files list from other file if specified.
00308         vector<string> listFiles;
00309         if(getOpt("list-files")!="") {
00310                 affx::TsvFile tsv;
00311 #ifdef WIN32
00312                 tsv.m_optEscapeOk = false;
00313 #endif
00314                 std::string listFilesFile = getOpt("list-files");
00315                 tsv.bind(0, getOpt("files-col"), &file, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00316 
00317                 try {
00318                         if(tsv.open(listFilesFile) != TSV_OK) {
00319                                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open list-files file: " + listFilesFile);
00320                         }
00321                 } catch (Except&) {
00322                         tsv.close();    // need to close the file
00323                         throw;
00324                 }
00325 
00326                 tsv.rewind();
00327                 while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00328                         listFiles.push_back(file);
00329                 }
00330                 tsv.close();
00331                 Verbose::out(1, "Read " + ToStr(listFiles.size()) + " list files from: " + Fs::basename(listFilesFile));
00332         }
00333         else
00334         {
00335                 listFiles = getOptVector("lists");
00336         }
00337         setOpt("lists",listFiles);
00338 }
00339 
00340 void ListSummaryEngine::writeHeader(std::ofstream &out, const string &signalColumn, list<pair<string, float> > *unknownCodeRates)
00341 {
00342         std::vector<std::string> option_names;
00343         getOptionNames(option_names);
00344         std::vector<PgOpt::PgOptType> option_types;
00345         getOptionTypes(option_types);
00346         for (int i = 0; i < option_names.size(); i++) 
00347         {
00348                 switch (option_types[i]) 
00349                 {
00350                 case PgOpt::BOOL_OPT:
00351                         out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOptBool(option_names[i]) << endl;
00352                         break;
00353                 case PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT:
00354                         out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOptDouble(option_names[i]) << endl;
00355                         break;
00356                 case PgOpt::INT_OPT:
00357                         out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOptInt(option_names[i]) << endl;
00358                         break;
00359                 case PgOpt::STRING_OPT:
00360                         if (getOpt(option_names[i]).empty() == false)
00361                                 out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOpt(option_names[i]) << endl;
00362                 }
00363         }
00364         if (unknownCodeRates != NULL)
00365         {
00366                 for (list<pair<string, float> >::iterator it=unknownCodeRates->begin(); it!=unknownCodeRates->end(); it++)
00367                 {
00368                         out << "#%Unknown Code Rate." << (*it).first << "=" << (*it).second << endl;
00369                 }
00370         }
00371         if (signalColumn.empty() == false)
00372         {
00373                 out << "#%signal-column=" << signalColumn << endl;
00374         }
00375 }
00376 
00377 /**
00378    This is the "main()" equivalent of the engine.
00379 */
00380 void ListSummaryEngine::runImp()
00381 {
00382         markerOrder.clear();
00383         mixMap.clear();
00384         annotMap.clear();
00385         readMixFile();
00386         readAnnotationFile();
00387 
00388         // Read the input list files and compute the median signal for each code.
00389         vector<string> listFiles = getOptVector("lists");
00390         //map<string, map<string, pair<uint64_t, int> > > summaryData;
00391         // map <LIST file name, map<partid, pair<array of median-cv in signal col order, count> > > summaryData
00392         map<string, map<string, pair< vector<uint64_t>, int> > > summaryData;
00393         list<pair<string, float> > unknownCodeRates;
00394         float unknownCodeRate;
00395         for (vector<string>::iterator it=listFiles.begin(); it!=listFiles.end(); it++)
00396         {
00397                 summaryData[*it] = computeMedianData(*it, unknownCodeRate);
00398                 unknownCodeRates.push_back(std::make_pair<string, float>(GetFileTitle(*it), unknownCodeRate));
00399         }
00400 
00401         // Output the data to the summary and CV files.
00402         vector<string> signalColumns = split(getOpt("signal-columns"));
00403         vector<string> summaryFiles = replaceTag(getOpt("summary-out-file"), "[SIGNAL_COLUMNS]", signalColumns);
00404         vector<string> cvFiles = replaceTag(getOpt("cv-out-file"), "[SIGNAL_COLUMNS]", signalColumns);
00405 
00406         for (int isignal = 0; isignal < summaryFiles.size(); ++isignal)
00407         {
00408                 int channel = isignal + 1; //decodeChannel(signalColumns[isignal]);
00409                 ofstream outSum(summaryFiles[isignal].c_str(), ios::out);
00410                 writeHeader(outSum, signalColumns[isignal]);
00411                 ofstream outCV(cvFiles[isignal].c_str(), ios::out);
00412                 writeHeader(outCV, signalColumns[isignal]);
00413 
00414                 // Output the column headers.
00415                 outSum << "probeset_id";
00416                 outCV << "probeset_id";
00417                 for (vector<string>::iterator it=listFiles.begin(); it!=listFiles.end(); it++)
00418                 {
00419                         const string& listFile = *it;
00420                         string title = GetFileTitle(listFile);
00421                         outSum << "\t" << title;
00422                         outCV << "\t" << title;
00423                 }
00424                 outSum << endl;
00425                 outCV << endl;
00426 
00427                 // Loop over each marker/allele and output its summary data.
00428                 for (list<string>::iterator orderIt=markerOrder.begin(); orderIt!=markerOrder.end(); orderIt++)
00429                 {
00430                         const string &id = *orderIt;
00431 
00432                         if (annotMap.find(id) != annotMap.end())
00433                         {
00434                                 const pair<string, string> &annot = annotMap[id];
00435                                 outSum << annot.first << "-" << annot.second[channel-1];
00436                                 outCV << annot.first << "-" << annot.second[channel-1];
00437                         }
00438                         else
00439                         {
00440                                 outSum << id;
00441                                 outCV << id;
00442                         }
00443 
00444                         for (vector<string>::iterator it=listFiles.begin(); it!=listFiles.end(); it++)
00445                         {
00446                                 const string& listFile = *it;
00447                                 outSum << "\t";
00448                                 outCV << "\t";
00449                                 if (summaryData[listFile].find(id) != summaryData[listFile].end())
00450                                 {
00451                                         uint64_t u64 = summaryData[listFile][id].first[isignal];
00452                                         uint32_t um = (uint32_t)(u64 >> 32);
00453                                         uint32_t ucv = (uint32_t)u64;
00454                                         outSum << *(float*)&um;
00455                                         outCV << *(float*)&ucv;
00456                                 }
00457                                 else
00458                                 {
00459                                         outSum << -1; //-std::numeric_limits<float>::infinity();
00460                                         outCV << -1; //-std::numeric_limits<float>::infinity();
00461                                 }
00462                         }
00463                         outSum << endl;
00464                         outCV << endl;
00465                 }
00466 
00467                 // Close the files.
00468                 outSum.close();
00469                 outCV.close();
00470         }
00471 
00472         // Write the counts file.
00473         string countFile = getOpt("count-out-file");
00474         ofstream outCount(countFile.c_str(), ios::out);
00475         writeHeader(outCount, "", &unknownCodeRates);
00476         outCount << "probeset_id";
00477         for (vector<string>::iterator it=listFiles.begin(); it!=listFiles.end(); it++)
00478         {
00479                 const string& listFile = *it;
00480                 string title = GetFileTitle(listFile);
00481                 outCount << "\t" << title;
00482         }
00483 
00484         outCount << endl;
00485 
00486         int oneChannel = -1;
00487         bool addAlleleCodeToCountsProbesetId = (annotationFileHasOneCode && signalColumns.size() == 1);
00488         if (addAlleleCodeToCountsProbesetId)
00489         {
00490                 oneChannel = 1; //decodeChannel(signalColumns[0]);
00491         }
00492 
00493         // Loop over each marker/allele and output its summary data.
00494         for (list<string>::iterator orderIt=markerOrder.begin(); orderIt!=markerOrder.end(); orderIt++)
00495         {
00496                 const string &id = *orderIt;
00497                 if (annotMap.find(id) != annotMap.end())
00498                 {
00499                         if (addAlleleCodeToCountsProbesetId)
00500                                 outCount << annotMap[id].first << "-" << annotMap[id].second[oneChannel-1];
00501                         else
00502                                 outCount << annotMap[id].first;
00503                 }
00504                 else
00505                 {
00506                         outCount << id;
00507                 }
00508 
00509                 for (vector<string>::iterator it=listFiles.begin(); it!=listFiles.end(); it++)
00510                 {
00511                         const string& listFile = *it;
00512                         outCount << "\t";
00513                         if (summaryData[listFile].find(id) != summaryData[listFile].end())
00514                         {
00515                                 outCount << summaryData[listFile][id].second;
00516                         }
00517                         else
00518                         {
00519                                 outCount << 0;
00520                         }
00521                 }
00522                 outCount << endl;
00523         }
00524         outCount.close();
00525 }
00526 
00527 map<string, pair< vector<uint64_t>, int> > ListSummaryEngine::computeMedianData(const string& listFile, float &unknownCodeRate)
00528 {
00529         int cvPercentile = getOptInt("cv-percentile");
00530         string includeAllCodesString = getOpt("include-all-codes");
00531         bool includeAllCodes = includeAllCodesString.length() > 0 && (includeAllCodesString[0] == 'y' || includeAllCodesString[0] == 'Y');
00532         map<string, vector<vector<double> > > data;
00533         string code;
00534         string id;
00535         string str_signal;
00536         double signal;
00537         unknownCodeRate = 0.0f;
00538 
00539         // Open the file and bind to the name and data columns.
00540         affx::TsvFile tsv;
00541         tsv.bind(0, getOpt("code-col"), &code, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00542         //tsv.bind(0, getOpt("signal-col"), &str_signal, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00543 
00544         vector<string> signalColumns = split(getOpt("signal-columns"));
00545         vector<string> str_signals;
00546         str_signals.resize(signalColumns.size());
00547 
00548         for (int ibind = 0; ibind < signalColumns.size(); ++ibind)
00549         {
00550                 tsv.bind(0, signalColumns[ibind], &str_signals[ibind], TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00551         }
00552 
00553         try {
00554                 if(tsv.open(listFile) != TSV_OK)
00555                         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + listFile);
00556         } catch (Except&) {
00557                 tsv.close();    // need to close the file
00558                 throw;
00559         }
00560 
00561         tsv.rewind();
00562 
00563         // Store the signal values for each marker.
00564         int totalParticles = 0;
00565         int totalFoundParticles = 0;
00566         while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)
00567         {
00568                 ++totalParticles;
00569                 if (mixMap.find(code) == mixMap.end())
00570                 {
00571                         if (includeAllCodes)
00572                         {
00573                                 // Include all codes even if they are not in the mix or annotation files.
00574                                 id = code;
00575                                 if (std::find(markerOrder.begin(), markerOrder.end(), code) == markerOrder.end())
00576                                 {
00577                                         markerOrder.push_back(code);
00578                                 }
00579                         }
00580                         else
00581                         {
00582                                 continue;
00583                         }
00584                 }
00585                 else
00586                 {
00587                         id = mixMap[code].first;
00588                         ++totalFoundParticles;
00589                 }
00590 
00591                 // Get the id (from the mix file) given the code name and find it in the annotation file.
00592                 //bool found = (annotMap.find(id) != annotMap.end());
00593 
00594                 // If the marker is not in the annotation file and the type is > 0 then ignore this.
00595                 // This is a way to fail markers in silico.
00596                 //if (mixMap[code].second > 0 && found == false)
00597                 //      continue;
00598 
00599                 // If the type is > 0 then get the id from the annotation mapping.
00600                 // This should be the allele name.
00601                 //if (mixMap[code].second > 0)
00602                 //      id = annotMap[id];
00603 
00604                 // If the probe id from the .mix file is found in the annotation file, then
00605                 // change the id to the annotation file code.
00606                 //if (found == true)
00607                 //{
00608                 //      id = annotMap[id].first;
00609                 //}
00610 
00611                 for (int icol = 0; icol < signalColumns.size(); ++icol)
00612                 {
00613                         if (str_signals[icol] == "NaN") {
00614                                 // throw exception per Carsten 12-14-2009
00615                                 //Err::errAbort("NaN signal value found: " + listFile);
00616                                 continue;
00617                         }
00618 
00619                         // Add an empty data vector to the map if not found.
00620                         if (data.find(id) == data.end())
00621                         {
00622                                 vector<vector<double> > empty;
00623                                 empty.resize(signalColumns.size());
00624                                 data[id] = empty;
00625                         }
00626 
00627                         // Add the signal to the vector.
00628                         signal = atof(str_signals[icol].c_str());
00629                         data[id][icol].push_back(signal);
00630                 }
00631         }
00632         tsv.close();
00633 
00634         // Compute the percentage of particles in the input file not found in the mix file.
00635         unknownCodeRate = 100.0f * (totalParticles - totalFoundParticles) / totalParticles;
00636 
00637         // Compute the median for each marker. If the number of particles
00638         // is less than a threshold then set the values to 0.
00639         map<string, pair< vector<uint64_t>, int> > medianData;
00640         for (map<string, vector<vector<double> > >::iterator it=data.begin(); it!=data.end(); it++)
00641         {
00642                 vector<uint64_t> result;
00643                 for (int icol = 0; icol < signalColumns.size(); ++icol)
00644                 {
00645                         std::sort(it->second[icol].begin(), it->second[icol].end());
00646                         float m = median(it->second[icol]);
00647                         float cv = PercentileCV(it->second[icol], cvPercentile, m);
00648                         int n = (int) it->second[icol].size();
00649                         uint32_t *um = (uint32_t *)&m;
00650                         uint32_t *ucv = (uint32_t *)&cv;
00651                         uint64_t u64 = ((uint64_t)*um << 32 | *ucv);
00652                         result.push_back(u64);
00653                 }
00654 
00655                 medianData[it->first] = std::make_pair(result, (int) it->second[0].size());     // all signal columns for a particle will have the same number of values.
00656         }
00657         return medianData;
00658 }
00659 
00660 void ListSummaryEngine::readAnnotationFile()
00661 {
00662         // Create a mapping of tag id to probe set allele codes
00663         string file = getOpt("annotation-file");
00664         TsvFile tsv;
00665         string probeid;
00666         string probesetid;
00667         string channel;
00668         string code;
00669         tsv.bind(0, getOpt("probe-id-col"), &probeid, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00670         tsv.bind(0, getOpt("probeset-id-col"), &probesetid, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00671         tsv.bind(0, getOpt("channel-col"), &channel, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00672         tsv.bind(0, getOpt("allele-code-col"), &code, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00673 
00674         try {
00675                 if(tsv.open(file) != TSV_OK)
00676                         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + file);
00677         } catch (Except&) {
00678                 tsv.close();    // need to close the file
00679                 throw;
00680         }
00681 
00682         // If the num-channels header parameter is missing assume this is an older annotation file with only 1 channel.
00683         annotationFileHasOneCode = true;
00684 
00685         string numChannels;
00686         tsv.headersBegin();
00687         if (tsv.headersFindNext("num-channels", numChannels) != TSV_HEADER_LAST)
00688         {
00689                 if (numChannels.empty() == false)
00690                         annotationFileHasOneCode = atoi(numChannels.c_str()) == 1;
00691         }
00692 
00693         //if(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)
00694         //{
00695         //      // If the annotation file knows about more than one channel, the counts files should not report
00696         //      // the allele code as part of the probeset id.
00697         //      vector<string> channels = split(channel, "//");
00698         //      annotationFileHasOneCode = (channels.size() == 1);
00699         //}
00700         //tsv.rewind();
00701 
00702         while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)
00703         {
00704                 markerOrder.push_back(probeid);
00705                 annotMap[probeid] = make_pair<string, string>(probesetid, parseAlleleCode(channel, code));
00706         }
00707         tsv.close();
00708 }
00709 
00710 void ListSummaryEngine::readMixFile()
00711 {
00712         // Create a a mapping of the particle code to combination of probe id and type.
00713         // The probe will be stored in the first entry of the pair.
00714         string mixFile = getOpt("marker-content-file");
00715         TsvFile tsv;
00716         string id;
00717         string code;
00718         string note;
00719         int typeValue;
00720         tsv.bind(0, getOpt("note-col"), &note, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00721         tsv.bind(0, getOpt("code-col"), &code, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00722         tsv.bind(0, getOpt("probe-id-col"), &id, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00723         tsv.bind(0, getOpt("type-col"), &typeValue, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00724 
00725         try {
00726                 if(tsv.open(mixFile) != TSV_OK)
00727                         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + mixFile);
00728         } catch (Except&) {
00729                 tsv.close();    // need to close the file
00730                 throw;
00731         }
00732 
00733         tsv.rewind();
00734         while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)
00735         {
00736                 if (id.empty() == true)
00737                 {
00738                         id = note;
00739                         markerOrder.push_back(id);
00740                 }
00741                 mixMap[code] = make_pair<string, int>(id, typeValue);
00742         }
00743         tsv.close();
00744 }
